law.catch_line: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated....

text.section: In this title the following words have the meanings indicated.
"Affidavit" means a statement executed under penalty of perjury.

"Chief election official" means:
as to the State Board, the State Administrator; or
as to a local board, the election director.
"Circulator" means an individual who attests to one or more signatures affixed to a petition.

"Election authority" means:
the State Board; or
as to a local petition, the local board for that county.

"Legal authority" means:
the Attorney General; or
as to a local petition, the counsel to the local board appointed under § 2-205 of this article for that county.

"Local petition" means a petition:
on which the signatures from only one county may be counted; and
that does not seek to:
refer a public local law enacted by the General Assembly; or
nominate an individual for an office for which a certificate of candidacy is required to be filed with the State Board.
"Page" means a piece of paper comprising a part of a petition.

"Petition" means all of the associated pages necessary to fulfill the requirements of a process established by the law by which individuals affix their signatures as evidence of support for:
placing the name of an individual, the names of individuals, or a question on the ballot at any election;
the creation of a new political party; or
the appointment of a charter board under Article XI-A, § 1A of the Maryland Constitution.
"Sponsor" means the person who coordinates the collection of signatures for a petition and who, if the petition is filed, is named on the information page as required by § 6-201 of this title.
